page.title: 11TRANSPORT IN SHREWSBURY.
page.content: The train is a popular form of public transport in Shrewsbury because the railway lines lead out in five compass directions;North,Northwest,West,South and East.When our class went by train to Church Stretton, we were 15 minutes late starting because our train had to wait for a connection with another. No. of trains dealt with per week-day. {Passenger Parcels Starting 33 4 Terminating 33 4 Through Services 29 12 Also 85{Freight}trains pass through. Richard's dad drives a{Midland Red bus.His shift & route varies daily.He thought the bus station was suitably placed in Barker Street but he did not like the one-way system in Shrewsbury. Country buses service the rural areas. Taxis,cars and cycles are also used. Haulage and Removal firms available.
